headline: Mary's Deviled Eggs
description: Make deviled eggs with Miracle Whip for just a touch of sweetness; season with mustard and paprika for an easy, crowd-pleasing appetizer.
name: Mary's Deviled Eggs
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®), or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, cover and remove from heat; let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water and cool in ice water.
Peel eggs and cut in half lengthwise. Transfer yolks into a bowl. Add mustard, salad dressing, salt, and pepper; mix until smooth.
Refill each egg half with the yolk mixture and sprinkle with paprika.

review.reviewBody: Got a lot of good feedback, very easy just mix till smooth and add a little more miracle whip or mustard if necessary. I used smoked paprika which they really liked! All of them were eaten!
love it
Try adding a smidge of horseradish powder (or fresh) to the yolk mixture for a slight kick --mmmm.
My first time making these eggs and have sampled many others. Found this recipe very bland.
Perfect way to make deviled eggs, I added just a little Worchester sauce to spice it up a bit and they were great.
Easy Peasy recipe! Great for a quick appetizer
Delicious basic recipe. I was looking for the quickest, no frills deviled egg recipe to get rid of some eggs and this did not disappoint :)
Started with this & increased the Miracle Whip to 4 tablespoons (1 per 2 eggs) and added 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar. Yummy and right consistency for filling egg whites.
It turned out really great. I added much more salad dressing.
Made this, added 1 tsp sugar and about 2 more tbsp mayonnaise.
Delicious!
I added 1-2 tsp sweet pickle relish. Delicious! I also used real mayo! LOVED IT! Will definitely make this again!
Always a favorite. I do make it a bit creamier with added salad dressing and tend to put a touch a sweet relish in the mix for added taste.

Not bad but I have some issues. I tried hard boiling the way they say and when I went to peel them they were barely soft boiled. One dozen eggs wasted. So then I tried again with just 4 eggs for my daughter. The measurements for the mustard and Mayo (I hate Miracle Whip) were way too little. I helped it for four eggs and wound up quadrupling what I started with, so double for the full recipe. My daughter ate them so they couldn’t be too bad.
it was good I ate them almost all of them and gave the last 2 to my daughter. she loved them.
Used black olives to make spider deviled eggs
This is an old fashioned recipe I grew up with and is super simple. I doubled the Miracle Whip and mustard and sprinkled with Mrs. Dash Original instead of paprika. Delish!

Great basic recipe for four eggs, although I used more mustard. A dash of ground pepper, a little salt and away we went. No way would this have been enough for 8! but perfect for four eggs. I think I’ll use mayonnaise next time though as I’m not really a fan of miracle whip.
I am not a mustard fan, so the yellow mustard was a little strong tasting for me. I prefer to use Dijon mustard. So good!
They were not chef quality but yummy anyway. Very creamy and I used dill instead of paprika.
awesome and delicious
Easy, simple recipe for the filling. Add what you want to it! I add horseradish to mine! The family loves it!
i made this i would add way more mustard i thought the filling was too sweet.
Added more miracle whip, salt, pepper, and a little bit of relish. Really tangy, and perfect texture.
I substituted horseradish sauce for the mayo. They were very flavorful.
Love the classics
A nice basic devilled egg recipe. I didn’t change anything
Just want to reiterate for anyone out there that didn't watch I Love Lucy. "Salad dressing" = mayonnaise, not ranch. I also added some pickle relish. Delicious!
Great recipe but I did tweak it and used about 1/2 cup of Mayo, 2 teaspoons of mustard and a bit of pepper to add more flavoring and to get a creamier texture. I used a dozen eggs for this recipe.
If I had miracle whip I would make it just like this (but with more miracle whip.) We usually use mayo with a cash of pickle juice!
I used regular mayo and put a dollop of old style mustard on the top instead of mixing it in - garnished with scallion sticks. Pretty and yummy!
So easy and so tasty! The perfect deviled egg,
I prefer with mayo.
Very good maybe more mustard
Big hit at the cook out I brought them too.
Easy..and good, can add what you want to this basic
No changes were made and will definitely make again
Great eggs
The recipe was a good start to help me get going but it was very dry. I had to increase both the mayo and the mustard to get a creamy consistency.
Made them accordingly to recipe, used more eggs and slightly increased mustard and miracle whip, everyone loved them, i didn’t have any left over
So simple a child could make it. A delicious appetizer or side dish.
Delicious recipe, but I did add much more salad dressing to make it more creamy.
Not enough salad dressing in the initial recipe. I had to add a lot more.
i add pickle relish

I would recommend using real mayonnaise instead of salad dressing. I used large eggs and they probably could have used a little more mayo than this recipe called for. They were a little dryer than I would have liked. Otherwise, they all got eaten pretty fast!

I have had deviled eggs many times before but I have never made them. I just wanted a simple but good recipe and that is what this is. I like others did add a little bit more mayo but that was it. It doesn’t have to be complicated to taste good. That is why I love this recipe it’s simplicity at its finest.
Great simple recipe. We used Dijon mustard for a little extra tang and sprinkled the eggs with bits of bacon. Everyone loved them!
I probably tripled the mayo and mustard and I only made 6 eggs. Very good though!
I will make it again for sure
Taste Reminds me of Easter with my great grandma. Classic flavor, simple and easy. I used mayonnaise and a little butter. Garnished with dill, paprika and cayenne. Loved it!
It came out too liquidy. Sorry butI think I will go back to my other recipe
Loved it

This is the way my grandmother and mother made them, and consequently, the way I make them. I use the same ingredients as listed, but I don't measure -- I go by taste and texture. My now grown sons always ask me to make these for the holidays, so I do, and there's never any left to take home!
I used mayo. Kids loved them.

Honestly, everything listed but the mustard, is the way I’ve been making deviled eggs forever. Miracle Whip is the only dressing to use. And I’ve never cared for mustard nor celery in my egg mixture. Sometimes less is more!
Added a little bit of milk and no peprika added alittle bit of Chilli spice to give it a kick
Just what I wanted: simple, straight-forward classic. Top mine with chives as well.
I use fat free mayo so maybe that’s why they were not stellar, probably needs more mustard also. Otherwise tasty and easy!
The perfect traditional deviled egg flavor. So simple! Suggestion - use a cookie press to fill the eggs. They look pretty and makes filling the eggs so easy.

Love the deviled egg recipe! My family really enjoyed.
I followed the recipe without any changes.
Will definitely make again. Used Mayo not M.Whip an added a little bit of pickle relish.

This is a great basic recipe! I used Hellmann's Light mayo instead of dressing because that's what I had, but the mixture was still a little dry so I kept adding mayo and mustard in equal measures until creamy. Taste was great! I will make this again! 

I also tried adding relish and some garlic dill pickle juice for a bit more punch!

These eggs are delicious. They are good a soon a they are done but even better after they sit for awhile in refrigerator. The garlic and dill flavors come out more. I changed the regular mayonnaise to the olive oil mayonnaise. It gives it a little more tartness. I will definitely make these again.
Simple and tasty!
Easy to make and excellent taste.

I loved these! I made these deviled eggs as a taste tester and got great reviews form my family. When the recipe says "salad dressing" you should actually use mayo. ( not miracle whip) : ) and you do not need to use prepared mustard, any mustard works. Tip, put the ingredients in a small bowl and then mix until creamy. Then, put it in a plastic bag, cut the tip off and squeeze the mixture into the egg!
Like this recipe. Simple , clear and delicious without the cloying taste that could otherwise.
Hmm....just like mom made and now how I make it. Can’t go wrong with this recipe. I tried it with plain mayonnaise but went back to miracle whip. I like the tang it gives it.

The ingredients for these deviled eggs is exactly the way I grew up eating them, except my mom's were always creamy. If you use the amount of Miracle Whip called for in this recipe, you will have very thick, clumpy filling that doesn't make enough for all the eggs. I had to add about 4 times the amount of Miracle Whip. Everything else was just right. Simple and tasty way to make these.

We like ours very creamy so we used 4 tblsp of miracle whip , 1tsp of mustard, and a 1/.2 tsp 50/50 salt pepper mix I use for BBQ. I also like paprika. There very yummy. Tip for boiling eggs do your self a favor and get an instapot we used 5-5-5 and the shells practically fall off the egg with no scaring of the egg and the yokes are creamy but cooked.
My family really liked them. Our kids asked for seconds
Just added a teaspoon of mustard . Delicious !
Great classic and simple recipe. The way traditional deviled eggs should taste.
It requires 4 times the amount of Miracle Whip (aka salad dressing) than it calls for. Otherwise it was OK.
My husband loved them.

My partner was craving deviled eggs and declared this recipe magnificent. i live in new zealand and we don't have iracle whip here, so i used the closest thing to it and used more than the recipe said.
I had to put more mayo and mustard that the recipe sayed it was
I used mayo but added more than it called for I also used more mustard. Without adding more it was too dry. Otherwise it was good!
Added bits of bacon to it Yumm!
This is pretty close to how my mom used to make them, except she used ground mustard instead of prepared mustard, so that's what I did, too. I also added a pinch of curry powder. Yum!

This is almost identical to a recipe that my mom had made for us all of our lives and now I continue the tradition and make for my family. The only addition is that I add sweet pickle relish and mayo instead of Miracle whip so it is not doubly sweet although I choose Miracle whip over mayo nine times out of ten.
This came out super dry and flavorless. I had to nearly double the mustard and mayo.
Just OK. Standard fare. Will try fancier versions when we have more time.

I am giving 4 stars only because I had to add a significant amount more miracle whip than what was called for, but overall, yummy and very fast to make! Thanks for a great recipe! I always add a black olive slice on top, it adds a good flavor.
None were left they were a big hit
I had a craving for deviled eggs yesterday, and this did the trick and was quite easy.

I made these deviled eggs for a baby shower appetizer. Everyone wanted the secret recipe. Used extra Kraft Miracle Whip with a few drops of Tabasco Sauce and French's Mustard. It give it a "kick"!
needs more "dressing" for the filling I added another tbsp.

I made this and it was great! I did make a few adjustments though. I used 9 eggs (that's what my tray holds), 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise (instead of miracle whip), 1 1/2 teaspoons yellow mustard, and I added 1/8 teaspoon of garlic powder. It's a hit!!
No changes.Yes I will make again
These were easy to make and good. I added a bit more miracle whip and some pickle juice until the right consistency. Also added some garlic powder. Yum
One word "yummy"

I never use edible oil products (Miracle Whip) and always use Mayo. I add more than is called for here for a creamier filling. If I'm serving these to guests I will usually pipe the filling in for a more uniform look.
This recipe was a good starting point, but I definitely had to add a lot more mayo than what the recipe called for.
I add a small amount of vinegar to give it a bit more zip. Good go to recipe
Just had to add more miracle whip, turned out great :)
3 stars as is, 5 stars with a few changes.... add 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tbsp sweet relish and use 2 tbsp Hellmanns mayo instead of miracle whip/dressing.
perfect traditional deviled eggs! I did add a little more mayo for a creamier consistancy but i loved them! Thank you for the recipe!
